abstract: Apple told a developer that it won’t distribute his podcasting application through the iPhone Apps Store because it competes with Apple’s iTunes software.
snippet: Apple told a developer that it won’t distribute his podcasting application through the iPhone Apps Store because it competes with Apple’s iTunes software.
lead_paragraph: Alex Sokirynsky spent two months, working nights and weekends, to write an application called Podcaster for the Apple iPhone, allowing people to listen to and watch Podcasts on their phones.

headline.main: Apple’s Capricious Rules for iPhone Apps
